org.opensha2.geo

Class LocationList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha2.geo.LocationList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Location>

    public final class LocationList
extends Object
implements Iterable<Location>
    An ordered collection of Locations.

    A LocationList must contain at least 1 Location. LocationList instances are immutable and calls to remove() when iterating will throw an UnsupportedOperationException. Consider using a LocationList.Builder if list is being compiled from numerous Locations that are not known in advance.

    Author:
    Peter Powers

      static class  LocationList.Builder
      A builder for creating LocationLists.

      • create

        @Deprecated
public static LocationList create(Location origin,
                             Iterable<Double> distances,
                             double azimuth)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new LocationList of Locations at the supplied distances and along the bearing specified by azimuth. The returned list does not start with the origin.
        Parameters:
        origin - Location
        distances - at which Locations exist in the returned list
        azimuth - from origin for computed locations
        Returns:
        a new LocationList

      • copyOf

        public static LocationList copyOf(LocationList locs)
        Creates a new LocationList that is an exact copy of the supplied LocationList. Because Locations and LocationLists are immutable, the returned copy references the same Locations as the supplied list.
        Parameters:
        locs - to populate list with
        Returns:
        a new LocationList

        Returns:
        a new LocationList

      • resampledFrom

        public static LocationList resampledFrom(LocationList locs,
                         double spacing)
        Creates a new LocationList by resampling the supplied list with the desired spacing. The actual spacing of the returned list will likely differ, as spacing is adjusted up or down to be closest to the desired value and maintain uniform divisions. The original vertices are also not preserved such that some corners might be adversely clipped if spacing is too large. Buyer beware.
        Parameters:
        locs - to resample
        spacing - resample interval
        Returns:
        a new LocationList

      • fromString

        public static LocationList fromString(String s)
        Creates a new LocationList from the supplied String. This method assumes that s is formatted in space-delimited xyz tuples, each of which are comma-delimited with no spaces (e.g. KML style).
        Parameters:
        s - String to read
        Returns:
        a new LocationList

      • length

        public double length()
        Returns the length of this LocationList in km. Method uses Locations.horzDistanceFast(Location, Location) algorithm. Method is lazy and repeat calls to this method will recalculate the length each time.
        Returns:
        the length of a line that connects all Locations in this list

      • averageDepth

        public double averageDepth()
        Lazily returns the average depth of the Locations in this list.

      • minDistToLocation

        public double minDistToLocation(Location loc)
        Computes the horizontal surface distance (in km) to the closest point in this list from the supplied Location. This method uses Locations.horzDistanceFast(Location, Location) to compute the distance.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location of interest
        Returns:
        the distance to the closest point in this LocationList
        See Also:
        Locations.horzDistanceFast(Location, Location)

      • minDistToLine

        public double minDistToLine(Location loc)
        Computes the shortest horizontal distance (in km) from the supplied Location to the line defined by connecting the points in this LocationList. This method uses Locations.distanceToSegmentFast(Location, Location, Location) and is inappropriate for for use at large separations (e.g. >200 km).
        Parameters:
        loc - Location of interest
        Returns:
        the shortest distance to the line defined by this LocationList

      • minDistIndex

        public int minDistIndex(Location loc)
        Computes the segment index that is closest to the supplied Location. There are LocationList.size() - 1 segment indices. The endpoints of the returned segment index are [n, n+1] .
        Parameters:
        loc - Location of interest
        Returns:
        the index of the closest segment
